meta.course: COMP 466 - Advanced Technologies for Web-Based System

content.point: The canvas elemetn provides a JavaScript API with methods for drawing two-dimensional bitmapped graphics and animations and etc.
By default, the upper-left corner of a canvas has the coordinates (0, 0).
The canvas element has two attributes - width and height.
A context object represents a 2D rendering surface that provides methods for drawing on a canvas.
fillRect method draws rectangle using the arguments x, y, width and height.
To draw lines and complex shapes in canvas, we use paths.
Arcs are portions of the circumference of a circle.
To draw an arc, you specify the arc's starting angle and ending angle measured in radians.
drawImage method is used to draw an image. An image must be stored in an Image object.
createpattern method can be used to create a pattern on the canvas.
Transformation can be applied to the canvas using translate, scale and rotate method.
fillText method can be used to create text on the canvas.
The globalAlpha attribute is used to change the transparency.
The canvas's state includes its current style and transformations, which are maintained in a stack.
The save method is used to save the context's current state.
The restore method restores the context to its previous state.
Most current browsers also support SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics), which offers a different approach to developing 2D graphics.
Vector graphics are made of scalable geometric primitives such as line segments and arcs.
